clinical_study.brief_title: Cost Effectiveness of the EndoPhys Pressure Sensing Access System vs. Radial A-line for Intra-operative Blood Pressure Monitoring
clinical_study.official_title: Cost Effectiveness of the EndoPhys Pressure Sensing Access System vs. Radial A-line for Intra-operative Blood Pressure Monitoring

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to compare the time difference between radial arterial line placement and use of the EndoPhys sheath, as well as, assess the cost effectiveness of the EnoPhys sheath vs. use of a radial arterial line based on device and operating room costs.

study_design_info.masking_description: Anesthesia team will not be made aware of the purpose of the trial.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Patient time in operating room (approximately 2 hours)
primary_outcome.description: Total cost of each approach, as defined by the sum of material (device) costs plus the value of operative room time per minute.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in preparation time between the two approaches
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From onset of anesthesia to successful insertion of the catheter (approximately 30 minutes)

secondary_outcome.measure: Complication rates between the two groups.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patient time in operating room (approximately 2 hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: Associated anticipated costs of complications between the two groups.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patient time in operating room (approximately 2 hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient satisfaction as assessed by post-operative questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaire is assessed post-operatively at one day and at the 2-4 week follow up (approximately 5 minutes to assess)

secondary_outcome.measure: Anesthesiologist satisfaction as assessed by post-operative questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaire is assessed post-operatively in the operating room (approximately 5 minutes to assess)

secondary_outcome.measure: Technical success of EndoPhys sheath for blood pressure measurement and accuracy as compared to the radial arterial line.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Upon EndoPhys sheath insertion until it is removed from the femoral artery (approximately 1.5 hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity analysis to evaluated variation in times for arterial line placement
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From onset of anesthesia to successful insertion of the catheter (approximately 30 minutes)

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity analysis to evaluated variable operating room time costs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patient time in operating room (approximately 2 hours)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All elective neuro endovascular procedures requiring general anesthesia and continuous invasive blood pressure monitoring
- Adequate access to both the radial or femoral artery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pre-operative identification of contra-indication for radial arterial line placement
- Hemodynamic instability
- Need for continued post-operative invasive blood pressure monitoring
- Failure to obtain informed consent
